name: Ensure DECFLOAT data type is not used
description: This rule checks if any DECFLOAT data type is used in DB2 Database(s).
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: As you decide to migrate from DB2 to PostgreSQL, it is important to note the changes to be taken care of during the migration process. Without adaptation, the SQL script won’t compile on Postgresql, leading to error
remediation: Replace DECFLOAT(16|34) data type with FLOAT data type.
sample:
SELECT CAST('NAN' AS DECFLOAT)            
FROM SYSIBM.SYSDUMMY1;
total: Number of SQL Tables and Artifacts with SQL code

technicalCriteria.name: Database Migration - DB2 Database to PostgreSQL
